caption.center: JOSEPH BELANGER et ux. v. ARMAND G. SILVA d.b.a. MAPLE HILL NURSERY v. JOHN
J. CLARKE INSURANCE, INC. and SHELBY MUTUAL INSURANCE COMPANY.

opinion.posture:
This is an action involving multiple parties. The third party plaintiff appeals from a summary judgment granted one of the third party defendants. An examination of the record fails to disclose compliance with Super. R. Civ. P. 54(b). This rule permits the entry of a final judgment as to one or more but fewer than all the claims or parties only upon an express determination by the trial justice that there is no just reason for delay and upon express direction that judgment may enter. Coro, Inc. v. R.N. Koch, Inc., 112 R.I. 371, 310 A.2d 622 (1973); Menzies v.Sigma Pi Alumni Ass'n, 110 R.I. 488, 294 A.2d 193 (1972);Goodyear Loan Co. v. Little, 107 R.I. 629, 269 A.2d 542 (1970);Calore Rigging Corp. v. Sterling Engineering Constr. Co.,105 R.I. 150, 250 A.2d 365 (1969). The requisite certification has not been made.
Case remanded to the Superior Court for further proceedings.
opinion.attorneys:
Peter D. Nolan, for Joseph Belanger et ux.
Robert R. Afflick, David G. Lussier, for third party plaintiff, Armand G. Silva.
Hanson, Curran, Bowen Parks, A. Lauriston Parks, for John J. Clarke Insurance, Inc.
Keenan, Rice, Dolan Reardon, Roderick A. J. Cavanagh, for Shelby Mutual Insurance Company.Page 925
